Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay let me tackle this user request The user wants 20 thoughtprovoking questions about a smartphone supply chain The process is complex with multiple stages RD sourcing from global suppliers manufacturing in Malaysia distribution via regional centers and aftersales support

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to understand the key areas where inefficiencies might occur The user mentioned lead times quality issues regulatory compliance cost management sustainability and technology integration The questions should encourage the LLM to explore these aspects deeply

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I should start by looking at the initial stages like supplier relationships Questions about lead times and uncertainties make sense here Then moving to manufacturing quality control and automation come up Distribution challenges like customs and lastmile delivery are important too

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Aftersales support and recalls are parts of the process that arent mentioned in the original description Including questions about managing returns and recalls would add depth Also considering sustainability goals and how the company balances cost vs ecofriendly practices

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: The user probably wants to uncover hidden issues like overreliance on specific suppliers or transportation dependencies Also how data analytics and ML models are used for predictive insights Maybe questions about JIT vs JIT and scenarios where each is optimal

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I need to ensure each question is openended and not answerable with a single fact For example instead of What is the average lead time we ask How do fluctuating supply chain disruptions impact That way the LLM has to think critically

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: Also considering implications of decisions Like if a retailers demand suddenly spikes how does it affect upstream suppliers Or how could a recall process be optimized These questions should drive strategic thinking

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Check for variety across the entire supply chain sourcing manufacturing logistics sales post sales Also stakeholder perspectives suppliers customers regulators Maybe include questions about ethical considerations or technological hurdles

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Avoid making the questions too technical in a way that requires specific data Keep them at a strategic level Ensure each question targets a different part of the process to cover all bases Finally review for clarity and the ability to stimulate deep analysis
